The <color #FF7B1A>linkshell</color> feature is now available!\n\nLinkshells are chat groups which allow for quick and easy communication between players who are not necessarily in a party or free company.
Linkshells can have up to <color #FF7B1A>128</color> members, while players may possess as many as <color #FF7B1A>eight</color> separate linkshells.

Upon reaching level 10, you will be allowed to rent chocobos from stables across Eorzea. Chocobos can be used for speedy transport to areas which are not readily accessible via aetheryte.\n\nWhile riding, you will have complete control over the chocobo until you either dismount or are attacked, or the rental period expires.

While on chocoback, a <color #FF7B1A>chocobo icon</color> will appear near your status effects bar indicating how much time is remaining before the rental period expires. You can end your ride at any time by selecting <color #FF7B1A>Dismount</color> from the pet hotbar. Be aware, however, that once you have dismounted, the chocobo will return to his stables, regardless of how much time is remaining.

While on chocoback, a <color #FF7B1A>chocobo icon</color> will appear near your status effects bar indicating how much time is remaining before the rental period expires. You can end your ride at any time by selecting <color #FF7B1A>Dismount</color> from the pet hotbar. Be aware, however, that once you have dismounted, the chocobo will return to his stables, regardless of how much time is remaining.

<color #FF7B1A>Chocobo porters</color> are similar to rental chocobos in that they can be hired to carry you quickly to destinations throughout Eorzea, the differences being that you cannot control these birds, and that they will not stop until they have arrived at their destination. On the other hand, chocobo porters are trained to take the safest route, meaning that they will never be attacked while in transit.

While on chocoback, a <color #FF7B1A>chocobo icon</color> will appear in your status effects bar. You can end your ride at any time by selecting <color #FF7B1A>Dismount</color> from the pet hotbar. Be aware, however, that once you have dismounted, the chocobo will continue on to his destination, leaving you behind.

While on chocoback, a <color #FF7B1A>chocobo icon</color> will appear in your status effects bar. You can end your ride at any time by selecting <color #FF7B1A>Dismount</color> from the pet hotbar. Be aware, however, that once you have dismounted, the chocobo will continue on to his destination, leaving you behind.

You can <color #FF7B1A>Use</color> a <color #FF7B1A>chocobo whistle</color> to acquire the <color #FF7B1A>action</color> to summon your personal chocobo. Unlike rental chocobos, there is no time limit regulating how long you may remain on chocoback. Remember, however, there are areas, such as highly populated cities and narrow dungeons, that your chocobo will refuse to enter.

The action to summon your chocobo can be set to your <color #FF7B1A>hotbar</color> and is located within your <color #FF7B1A>Mount Guide</color> found under <color #FF7B1A>Character</color> in the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>.
If you are attacked while on chocoback, your steed may buck you and run off to safety. You may only summon him again once the immediate threat has been neutralized.
Chocobo armor, or “barding,” can be equipped via the <color #FF7B1A>Companion</color> interface situated in the <color #FF7B1A>Character</color> section of the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>.

While on chocoback, a <color #FF7B1A>chocobo icon</color> will appear in your status effects bar. You can dismount your chocobo at any time by right-clicking this icon or by reclicking the <color #FF7B1A>action</color> you used to mount your steed. Use the chocobo whistle to summon your steed again.

While on chocoback, a <color #FF7B1A>chocobo icon</color> will appear in your status effects bar. You can dismount your chocobo at any time by selecting this icon or by reselecting the <color #FF7B1A>action</color> you used to mount your steed. Use the chocobo whistle to summon your steed again.

In addition to riding him, you can also summon your chocobo to fight alongside you. To do so, you will first require a bunch of <color #FF7B1A>gysahl greens</color>. This chocobo favorite can be purchased in stores.

To summon your chocobo, simply <color #FF7B1A>Use</color> the greens. As a rule, chocobos can only fight in the same places in which they can be ridden, so don't expect your faithful steed to follow you into the depths of dungeons like the TamTara Deepcroft or Copperbell Mines.

Once summoned to battle, your chocobo will remain with you for 30 minutes (Earth time), or until he suffers injuries grievous enough to make him flee.\n\nTo give your companion orders, use the commands located under <color #FF7B1A>Companions</color> in the Actions & Traits interface.
To order your chocobo to auto-attack, simply select <color #FF7B1A>Free Stance</color>. You can dismiss your companion at any time by selecting the command <color #FF7B1A>Withdraw</color>.
Use another bunch of gysahl greens to summon your steed again.
As your chocobo's rank increases, he will earn skill points (<color #FF7B1A>SP</color>). These points can be used to acquire new companion-specific actions and traits.

There are three different skill trees you can choose for your chocobo: <color #FF7B1A>Defender</color>, <color #FF7B1A>Attacker</color>, and <color #FF7B1A>Healer</color>. When your chocobo acquires his first skill from any of these trees, he will also learn that tree's <color #FF7B1A>stance</color>.

Activating the <color #FF7B1A>Defender Stance</color> will turn your chocobo into a defensive-minded stalwart. The <color #FF7B1A>Attacker Stance</color> will transform your chocobo into an offensive force. Finally, the <color #FF7B1A>Healer Stance</color> will have your chocobo focus on restoring your HP rather than participating in battle.

How you choose to use your chocobo's skill points is entirely up to you, but remember─once an action or trait has been purchased, that purchase cannot be undone. Think about how you wish to use your chocobo in battle and choose its path of progression wisely.

The <color #FF7B1A>hunting log</color> is a record of your completion of tasks involving the slaying of certain creatures. By completing these tasks, you will earn rewards and unlock new challenges. The log can be accessed via <color #FF7B1A>Logs</color> found in the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>, or by pressing <color #FF7B1A>H</color> on your keyboard.

Once the log is open, select a class and difficulty to view the available challenges for that rank. Each challenge is marked with a class name and number, such as <color #FF7B1A>Lancer 01</color>. Below that name and number you will find the target, as well as how many of the target you must defeat. Hovering over the target name will display one of the areas in which the target can be located.
Targets indicated in your hunting log will have a special icon above their <color #FF7B1A>display name</color>, making it easier to locate the creatures.

The log can be accessed via <color #FF7B1A>Logs</color> found in the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>.

Below that name and number you will find the target, as well as how many of the target you must defeat. Hovering over the target name will display one of the areas in which the target can be located.
Targets indicated in your hunting log will have a special icon above their <color #FF7B1A>display name</color>, making it easier to locate the creatures.

You are now a member of a <color #FF7B1A>Grand Company</color> and have been assigned the rank of <color #FF7B1A>private third class</color>.\n\nYour Grand Company and rank can be confirmed at any time under the <color #FF7B1A>Profile</color> tab in the <color #FF7B1A>Character</color> interface under <color #FF7B1A>Character</color> in the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>.

Grand Companies pay their members not in gil, but in company seals. You can confirm how many seals are currently in your possession under the <color #FF7B1A>Currency</color> in the main menu.\n\nSeals can be earned by completing various Grand Company missions.

A Grand Company <color #FF7B1A>quartermaster</color> is stationed at each Grand Company headquarters, and will exchange items for company seals. Company seals are only redeemable with the Grand Company that issued them.

The Grand Companies of Eorzea are in constant need of <color #FF7B1A>supplies</color> and <color #FF7B1A>provisions</color> to maintain their daily operations. Adventurers can earn experience points and <color #FF7B1A>company seals</color> by crafting or gathering the items required and delivering them. Speak to a Grand Company <color #FF7B1A>personnel officer</color> or one of the many officers stationed throughout the realm to complete the delivery.
Items sought change every day (Earth time). They can be confirmed by selecting <color #FF7B1A>Timers</color> located under <color #FF7B1A>Duty</color> in the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>.

To bolster their strength, the Grand Companies of Eorzea seek donations of rare items. Accepted items are those which are <color #FF7B1A>sellable</color>, and whose names are <color #FF7B1A>not yellow</color> in their help window. <color #FF7B1A>Aetherial gear</color> is an example of such.
If you wish to make a donation, speak to a Grand Company <color #FF7B1A>quartermaster</color> to complete the delivery. You will be rewarded company seals for your contribution.

Free companies are independent player-operated organizations, not unlike guilds. While there are no restrictions on who may join a company, players cannot belong to more than one free company at a time.

Companies will advance in rank as their members earn <color #FF7B1A>company points</color> by undertaking various duties around Eorzea. These tasks will also earn companies <color #FF7B1A>credits</color>, which can be used as currency to purchase various items.
To form a company, a player must first draft a petition and then get three other players to sign it. These three players will become the founding members of the company.

You have been asked to sign a free company petition. To form a new free company, a player must first obtain the signatures of three other people who agree to become the founding members of the company. If you wish to join, sign the petition!
You have joined a free company! Start by changing your chat mode to <color #FF7B1A>Free Company</color> and greeting the other members.

Selecting <color #FF7B1A>Free Company</color> from the <color #FF7B1A>Social</color> section of the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color> will display the Free Company interface. Here you can view company and member data, messages, and other important information.\n\nEach member is assigned a <color #FF7B1A>rank</color>, each with various levels of </color>authorization</color>.
Depending on your rank, you may or may not be able to access such features as <color #FF7B1A>promoting</color> current members or <color #FF7B1A>inviting</color> new players.

As company members participate in various duties around Eorzea, they will not only earn experience points for themselves, but points for their free company as well. As company points are earned, the free company will increase in rank. As rank increases, new features such as <color #FF7B1A>company crests</color>, an expanded <color #FF7B1A>company chest</color>, and <color #FF7B1A>housing</color> become available.

The <color #FF7B1A>company chest</color> is a communal depository where free company members can store their excess gear and items. It can be accessed not only from the company's estate, but from Grand Company headquarters, and other convenient locations. Access rights are set by company leaders and can range from full access to all members to restricted access for a select few.

As the company increases in rank, additional compartments will be added to the chest, increasing the number of items which can be stored within.\n\nRemember, unlike your personal inventory, the company chest is shared. To avoid misunderstandings with fellow company members, refrain from using the chest to store important personal effects.

Your free company can now create its own unique <color #FF7B1A>company crest</color>. To edit the company crest you must first have <color #FF7B1A>authorization</color> to do so. Next, you must speak with an <color #FF7B1A>OIC officer of arms</color> located at one of the three Grand Company of Eorzea headquarters.
Once your company has attained the proper rank, you will have the opportunity to apply the crest to pieces of armor for all the realm to see.

<color #FF7B1A>Company Actions</color> can be used to temporarily increase the statuses of all online company members. They can be accessed under <color #FF7B1A>Actions</color> in the <color #FF7B1A>Free Company</color> interface.

Actions can be purchased from <color #FF7B1A>OIC quartermasters</color> with <color #FF7B1A>company credits</color>. The higher your company's <color #FF7B1A>standing</color> with its Grand Company of allegiance, the fewer credits the actions will require.
To purchase, execute, disable, or discard actions, you must first have been granted the proper company <color #FF7B1A>authorization</color> to do so.

Speaking with a local distributor of guildleves, known as a <color #FF7B1A>levemete</color>, will bring up a list of available levequests. Highlight a quest to display its objectives, and select <color #FF7B1A>Accept</color> to add the quest to your <color #FF7B1A>journal</color>.

<color #FF7B1A>Leve allowances</color> are required to accept levequests. You will be granted three leve allowances every 12 hours (Earth time), up to a maximum of 100.\n\nYou may accept as many as 16 levequests at once.

To initiate a levequest, first open your <color #FF7B1A>journal</color> via the <color #FF7B1A>Duty</color> section of the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>, or by pressing <color #FF7B1A>J</color> on your keyboard. Next, select the levequest to bring up a detailed description of its objectives and its rewards.

Clicking on the <color #FF7B1A>Map</color> button will show the approximate location of the levequest's objectives. Though you can initiate a levequest at any time while in the corresponding area, it is recommended that you wait until you are close to the objectives before doing so. This will increase your chances of becoming eligible for completion bonuses.
Once you have arrived, open the journal, select the levequest, and click on the <color #FF7B1A>Initiate</color> button to begin your duty.

To initiate a levequest, first open your <color #FF7B1A>journal</color> via the <color #FF7B1A>Duty</color> section of the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>. Next, select the levequest to bring up a detailed description of its objectives and its rewards.

Selecting the <color #FF7B1A>Map</color> button will show the approximate location of the levequest's objectives. Though you can initiate a levequest at any time while in the corresponding area, it is recommended that you wait until you are close to the objectives before doing so. This will increase your chances of becoming eligible for completion bonuses.
Once you have arrived, open the journal, select the levequest, and press the <color #FF7B1A>Initiate</color> button to begin your duty.

When you initiate a levequest, you will be given the opportunity to adjust its difficulty. The greater the difficulty setting, the higher the level target enemies will be. Difficulty also affects completion rewards.

Levequest difficulty can be lowered at any time during the course of the duty by selecting the quest name in the <color #FF7B1A>duty list</color> and selecting <color #FF7B1A>Difficulty</color>.\n\nPlease note that levequest difficulty cannot be raised once the duty has been initiated.

Once you have initiated a levequest, the location of your quest objectives will be displayed on the <color #FF7B1A>minimap</color>. Levequest targets can also be identified by the distinguishing icon displayed above their names.

During a levequest, the <color #FF7B1A>duty list</color> is replaced with information regarding quest objectives, leve difficulty, time remaining, and more. Rewards are only granted to those who complete all the objectives listed within the time allotted.

When all levequest objectives have been completed, you will be given the option to return immediately to the issuing <color #FF7B1A>levemete</color> and collect your reward, though rewards can be collected at any time from any levemete in Eorzea.

If you fail to complete the levequest objectives within the allotted time, you can always rechallenge the quest by selecting it in your <color #FF7B1A>journal</color> and pressing the <color #FF7B1A>Retry</color> button. Rechallenging a levequest will cost one <color #FF7B1A>leve allowance</color>.

If you fail to complete the levequest objectives within the allotted time, you can always rechallenge the quest by selecting it in your <color #FF7B1A>journal</color> and pressing the <color #FF7B1A>Retry</color> button. Rechallenging a levequest will cost one <color #FF7B1A>leve allowance</color>.

<color #FF7B1A>Tradecraft</color> leves (guildleves for Disciples of the Hand) are governed by a different set of rules than their <color #FF7B1A>battlecraft</color> counterparts (guildleves for Disciples of War and Magic). For example, tradecraft leves have no time limit, and are considered complete when the items requested have been delivered to the client. Information on leve objectives as well as the client's name can be viewed in the <color #FF7B1A>duty list</color>.

After creating all the requested items, speak with the client to bring up the Item Request window. Drag the items from your inventory into the Item Request window and click <color #FF7B1A>Hand Over</color> to complete the transaction. Submitting <color #FF7B1A>HQ</color> items will earn you a greater reward.

After creating all the requested items, speak with the client to bring up the Item Request window. Select the items from your inventory into the Item Request window and select <color #FF7B1A>Hand Over</color> to complete the transaction. Submitting <color #FF7B1A>HQ</color> items will earn you a greater reward.

<color #FF7B1A>Fieldcraft</color> leves (guildleves for Disciples of the Land) follow the same set of rules as their <color #FF7B1A>battlecraft</color> counterparts (guildleves for Disciples of War and Magic). There are, however, two main differences: you cannot begin a fieldcraft levequest unless you have changed to the corresponding class, and you must perform these tasks solo.

Leves for <color #FF7B1A>Fishers</color>, on the other hand, follow the same set of rules as tradecraft leves, in that you will be required to deliver your catch to the client in person. And, just as with leves for Disciples of the Hand, high-quality fish will earn you heftier rewards.

Once a leve has been initiated, its objectives will appear in the <color #FF7B1A>duty list</color>. Fieldcraft leve objectives range from visiting specified locations to gathering the specified number of items, all within the allotted time limit.

Levequest targets are indicated with a <color #FF7B1A>leve plate icon</color> displayed above their <color #FF7B1A>display names</color>. The general location of targets is also marked on your <color #FF7B1A>minimap</color>.
If you possess the same guildleve as the one activated by your party, a leve link will occur, ensuring that you receive full recompense upon completing the quest.

FATE is short for <color #FF7B1A>Full Active Time Event</color>. These public quests occur periodically in real time around Eorzea, and anyone can participate by simply showing up before one ends. When you sense a FATE nearby, a message will appear on your screen, and the location will be displayed on your maps.
The type of FATE in progress can be identified by its map icon. Mousing over the icon will display the FATE title.
You will automatically join a FATE the moment you cross the event threshold. At this time, the FATE title, objectives, and time remaining will appear in your <color #FF7B1A>duty list</color>.

If you are several levels higher than the recommended level, a <color #FF7B1A>Level Sync</color> button will appear in your duty list. Press the button to automatically lower your level so that you may participate and receive rewards.
Once a FATE is complete, a window detailing your reward will be displayed. Rewards are distributed to all event participants and are based not only on success, but on individual contributions.

The more active you are in completing event objectives, the greater your contribution will be deemed. Contribution is indicated via the gold, silver, or bronze medal that appears on your reward window.

<color #FF7B1A>Guildhests</color> are special operations organized by Adventurers' Guilds and overseen by NPCs known as <color #FF7B1A>battlewardens</color>. Speaking with a battlewarden displays a list of all guildhests currently available. Please note, however, that each operation has conditions (such as <color #FF7B1A>level</color> or <color #FF7B1A>class</color>) that must be met by all party members before the duty can be commenced.

At first, you may find that only a limited number of guildhests are accessible, but do not worry. As you progress in level, that number will grow.\n\nGuildhests can also be accessed via the <color #FF7B1A>Duty Finder</color>, removing the hassle of having to try and gather a party.

Once you have commenced a guildhest, the operation's objectives and the time remaining to complete them will appear in the <color #FF7B1A>duty list</color>. Hints helpful to completing guildhest objectives will sometimes appear on screen. These hints will also be added to the duty list after being displayed.\n\nIf you are unable to complete the objectives within the allotted time, the guildhest will be deemed a failure.

While participating in guildhests, you may notice areas that are colored differently than the surrounding landscape. This color is to warn players that stepping into the hazardous zones will trigger new enemies to appear. Take care when passing nearby.

If you are KO'd while participating in a guildhest, you will be given the option to return to the <color #FF7B1A>starting point of the operation</color>, rather than all the way back to your home point.

If you successfully complete all guildhest objectives in the time allotted, you will be eligible for a reward. Speak with the <color #FF7B1A>battlewarden</color> overseeing the operation to collect it. If your party can complete the objectives without suffering a single casualty, you will be rewarded a special bonus.

You are now able to change your Grand Company of <color #FF7B1A>allegiance</color>. To proceed with the necessary paperwork, speak with a <color #FF7B1A>personnel officer</color> at any of the Grand Company headquarters.\n\nDo note that upon changing allegiances, all assets (company seals) will be frozen, and some items, such as company-specific gear, may no longer be equippable. Furthermore, there is a cooling-off period of 15 days during which time you will be unable to apply for another transfer.

You can now craft items using <color #FF7B1A>Quick Synthesis</color>. Quick synthesis is available for any item you have successfully crafted at least once using traditional methods, and can significantly reduce the amount of time required to create multiple normal-quality items.

To begin quick synthesis, open your <color #FF7B1A>crafting log</color>, select the desired recipe, and then press the <color #FF7B1A>Quick Synthesis</color> button to the immediate left of the <color #FF7B1A>Synthesize<color #FF7B1A> button.
As quick synthesis only focuses on completing the recipe as fast as possible, it is difficult to produce high-quality items. If quality is your aim, normal synthesis is recommended.

All Disciples of the Hand receive a <color #FF7B1A>crafting log</color> which contains the recipes of every item they can synthesize. The crafting log can be opened by selecting <color #FF7B1A>Logs</color> from the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>.
To begin synthesis, you must first select the crafting class and level tier of the item you wish to create.

Once you have highlighted the item, confirm if you possess all the <color #FF7B1A>materials</color> necessary in your inventory. If you do, select the <color #FF7B1A>Synthesize</color> button to begin the crafting process.
Crafting is similar to battle in that various <color #FF7B1A>actions</color> are used to proceed.

Successfully crafting an item entails executing <color #FF7B1A>Synthesis</color> actions to achieve 100% <color #FF7B1A>progress</color> before material <color #FF7B1A>durability</color> reaches zero.
If durability reaches zero before progress has reached 100%, the synthesis will fail and some of the materials may be lost.
Items that you have successfully crafted at least once will appear with a check mark to the left of their icons. Crafting an item for the first time will earn you a special experience point bonus.
Crafting is similar to battle in that various <color #FF7B1A>actions</color> are used to proceed.
Increasing an item's <color #FF7B1A>quality</color> during synthesis improves chances that the resulting product will be of a higher grade (<color #FF7B1A>HQ</color>).

Quality is normally improved by using <color #FF7B1A>Touch</color> actions. However, in addition to reducing material durability, these actions also require crafting points (<color #FF7B1A>CP</color>) to execute.
The higher the overall quality of a completed item, the higher the experience point reward will be.

Quality is normally improved by using <color #FF7B1A>Touch</color> actions. However, in addition to reducing material durability, these actions also require crafting points (<color #FF7B1A>CP</color>) to execute.
As synthesis progresses, material <color #FF7B1A>condition</color> will fluctuate between excellent and poor.

Using <color #FF7B1A>Touch</color> actions when condition is either <color #FF7B1A>good</color> or <color #FF7B1A>excellent</color> will result in greater increases in quality when the action is successful. Note, however, that in the following step, material condition will always drop to <color #FF7B1A>poor</color>.
Some recipes are aspected to one of the six elements─<color #FF7B1A>fire, water, lightning, wind, earth, or ice</color>─reducing the effectiveness of normal, unaspected synthesis.
In these cases, Disciple of the Hand actions such as <color #FF7B1A>Brand of Wind</color> or <color #FF7B1A>Brand of Earth</color> are recommended as they allow for smoother progress.
Every time you use an action, receive damage, or suffer a KO, the gear you have equipped is damaged. When your gear's condition reaches 0%, its functionality drops off severely.

Gear condition can be viewed by selecting Character under <color #FF7B1A>Character</color> from the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>. The vertical bar situated next to each gear icon indicates approximate condition. An exact percentage can be viewed in the item help text by mousing over the icon.
NPCs conducting item repairs are indicated on your <color #FF7B1A>map</color> and <color #FF7B1A>minimap</color> by a hammer icon. For a small fee, they will restore an item's condition to 100%.
Disciples of the Hand have the ability to <color #FF7B1A>repair</color> their own items. To begin mending an item, select its icon and choose Repair.

Each item has class and level restrictions on who can repair it. This information can be viewed in an item's help text. In addition to meeting these restrictions, Disciples of the Hand must also use the proper grade of <color #FF7B1A>dark matter</color> to complete the repairs. Dark matter can be purchased from Grand Company quartermasters.

You have obtained a high-quality item! HQ items can be identified by their icon, as well as by the special mark that appears after their name.\n\n<color #FF7B1A>HQ</color> gear will often have better stats than normal-quality items, while HQ materials used in synthesis will sometimes yield better results. These features make them more attractive to prospective buyers, resulting in higher selling prices.
HQ items cannot be stacked with normal-quality items.
You have obtained a <color #FF7B1A>unique</color> item.\n\nAs this item is special, you can never possess more than one at a time.
An item you have equipped is now <color #FF7B1A>bound</color> to you and can no longer be traded or put up for sale in the markets.

Most items can be sold and traded freely before they are used in battle, crafting, or gathering. This is true regardless of whether or not they have been equipped. However, performing one of these three actions after equipping a new piece of gear will bind the item to you, preventing future trade or sale to other players (NPC shops will still purchase bound items).

The <color #FF7B1A>markets</color> are a venue in which players from across the realm can either sell their own items using hired hands known as <color #FF7B1A>retainers</color> or purchase the items of another. The markets can be accessed by targeting and selecting one of the many <color #FF7B1A>market boards</color> conveniently located throughout Eorzea's towns and city-states.

The markets of Limsa Lominsa, Gridania, Ul'dah, and Ishgard are all connected, meaning that items put up for sale in one city-state can be viewed as well as purchased by players accessing the markets in a second city-state.

Sifting through the sheer number of items up for sale in the markets can prove an overwhelming task for those not familiar with the system. As most gear required for the first few levels of any class can be easily found at local NPC-run shops, it is recommended that players start here, and then work their way to the markets once they feel those shops can no longer meet their needs.

Before you can purchase an item from the markets, you must first find it. There are two different ways you can do this─one involves doing a direct search by typing in the name of the item you seek. The second consists of specifying search conditions to bring up a list of corresponding items.

If you know the exact name of the item you seek, then you need only type it in the <color #FF7B1A>Free Search</color> box and then press the <color #FF7B1A>Search</color> button located in the lower left-hand corner of the window. Typing an incomplete entry will bring up all items that begin with those letters. For example, typing <color #FF7B1A>Boarskin Cr</color> will display both Boarskin Crakows and Boarskin Crakows of Gathering.

If you would rather list all items that fall under a certain category, start by specifying search conditions from <color #FF7B1A>Main Arm</color>, <color #FF7B1A>Armor</color>, or <color #FF7B1A>Items</color> located under <color #FF7B1A>Category Search</color>. For example, if you wanted to view all footwear equippable by level 35 archers, you would first click on the <color #FF7B1A>Feet</color> icon under Armor, set the level indicator to <color #FF7B1A>35</color>, and then finally click the <color #FF7B1A>Search </color> button.
If there are any matches to your search, they will be displayed in the window to the right. The number to the right of the name indicates how many of the item are available for purchase.
If an item in the search list is available for purchase, you can select the icon to bring up a second list indicating the item's selling prices, ordered from lowest to highest.

Select the item you wish to buy to display a final prompt from which you can confirm or cancel the transaction.\n\nA transaction fee will be charged for purchasing an item from a market outside the city-state you are currently in.
If you have a <color #FF7B1A>retainer</color> in your employ, you can have her place items up for sale in the markets. A <color #FF7B1A>5%</color> tax is charged to every sale.

To put an item up for sale, you must first entrust it to your retainer. Next, select the item from her inventory and decide upon a selling price. The number listed in the list represents the buying price offered by NPCs.

Items that are <color #FF7B1A>untradable</color> or <color #FF7B1A>bound</color> to you cannot be sold to other players, therefore you will be unable to move them from your retainer's inventory to the Market window.

<color #FF7B1A>Summoning bells</color> are used to call forth any retainers you have in your employ. Retainers are helpful NPCs who can be hired by players to maintain items and gil, as well as place goods up for sale in the markets.

Once you have been given approval to hire retainers, speak with <color #FF7B1A>Frydwyb</color> in Limsa Lominsa, <color #FF7B1A>Parnell</color> in Gridania, or <color #FF7B1A>Chachabi</color> in Ul'dah to have them draft a contract of employment.

<color #FF7B1A>Retainers</color> are helpful NPCs who can be hired by players to carry out such tasks as storing excess gil and gear, or selling unwanted items on the markets. They may also be sent afield on <color #FF7B1A>ventures</color>.

A contract of service can be drafted by <color #FF7B1A>Frydwyb</color> in Limsa Lominsa, <color #FF7B1A>Parnell</color> in Gridania, or <color #FF7B1A>Chachabi</color> in Ul'dah. Players may hire no more than two retainers at once.

Once a retainer is summoned, you can entrust her with gil or items, as well as have her put entrusted items up for sale in the markets. Additionally, you can also send her afield on <color #FF7B1A>ventures</color>.

To entrust an item to or retrieve an item from your retainer, simply drag it from one inventory window to the other. To transfer gil, click on the <color #FF7B1A>Gil Transfer</color> button to open a separate window.
Some gathering points will possess certain characteristics that, when exploited, may increase overall yield, chances of obtaining high-quality items, or number of gathering attempts.
Gathering point characteristics are displayed directly beneath a point's integrity bar, but only can be seen after acquiring one of the Disciple of the Land <color #FF7B1A>Whisperer</color> traits.

The higher your <color #FF7B1A>perception</color> rating, the better chance you have of obtaining high-quality (<color #FF7B1A>HQ</color>) items while gathering.\n\n(Some items do not have an HQ counterpart.)

You can use the botanist action <color #FF7B1A>Preparation</color> to confirm how high your perception rating must be before you are able to obtain HQ items. The percentage displayed in the gathering interface indicates your chance of success.

Using certain actions or meeting certain attribute conditions can increase your chances of finding HQ items, but only if your perception rating is sufficient enough to obtain HQ items in the first place.

Botanists can use hatchets and other cutting tools to log the forests of Eorzea and gather materials for use in crafting. Trees that are prime for logging are known as <color #FF7B1A>mature trees</color>.

Mature trees are only discernible from other foliage when using the action <color #FF7B1A>Triangulate</color>. While this action is active, the location of mature trees is displayed on the <color #FF7B1A>minimap</color>.
Once you have arrived at a mature tree, right-click it to begin logging.

Mature trees are only discernible from other foliage when using the action <color #FF7B1A>Triangulate</color>. While this action is active, the location of mature trees is displayed on the <color #FF7B1A>minimap</color>.
Once you have arrived at a mature tree, target and select it to begin logging.
As many as eight different types of items can be found on a single gathering point. Begin gathering by selecting an item from the list that appears after right-clicking the target.

Your chances of successfully obtaining the selected item are displayed as a percentage to the right of its icon. Gear with a high <color #FF7B1A>gathering</color> rating will improve these chances, but only if your class level is at or above the item level (also displayed to the right of the item icon).

An item's position on the list is determined by its type. For example, <color #FF7B1A>branches</color> are always found in the third slot. Remembering which type of items are located in which slots will help you when coming across a new type of mature tree.

A list of items available through gathering can be viewed by opening the <color #FF7B1A>gathering log</color>. This feature is accessible via <color #FF7B1A>Logs</color> in the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>.
Items that you have successfully gathered at least once will appear with a check mark to the left of their icons. Gathering an item for the first time will earn you a special experience point bonus.
Certain items can only be obtained in certain areas. To confirm where an item might be found, refer to your gathering log.
The Disciple of the Land action <color #FF7B1A>Stealth</color> allows you to conceal yourself from enemies so that you may log, mine, or fish without fear of being attacked.

The one drawback to this command is that it reduces movement speed by almost half, so when there are no threats nearby, it is recommended that you cancel the status by selecting the Stealth icon on your <color #FF7B1A>hotbar</color> once again.

Stealth cannot be used if you are being attacked by an enemy. Also, enemies with levels significantly higher than yours may be able to detect you, regardless of whether or not you have Stealth activated.
The Disciple of the Land action <color #FF7B1A>Stealth</color> allows you to conceal yourself from enemies so that you may log, mine, or fish without fear of being attacked.

In addition to logging, botanists can use secondary tools to <color #FF7B1A>harvest</color> items from patches of foliage referred to as <color #FF7B1A>lush vegetation</color>. As is the case with mature trees, these locations are only discernible when using the action <color #FF7B1A>Triangulate</color>.
To harvest, you must first equip a <color #FF7B1A>scythe</color> to your <color #FF7B1A>off hand</color>. Scythes can be obtained from shops, markets, or quests.
You have obtained a whistle with which you can summon your very own minion! To learn the <color #FF7B1A>Call Minion</color> action, you must first <color #FF7B1A>Use</color> the whistle.

Once you have used the item, a new entry will appear in your <color #FF7B1A>Minion Guide</color> found under <color #FF7B1A>Character</color> in the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>. You can either initiate the action from this menu, or drag the icon, set it to one of your <color #FF7B1A>hotbars</color>, and initiate it from there.

To send your minion away, simply re-select the summoning icon.\n\nMinions can be summoned or dismissed at any time, and the whistle has no recast timer. Once you have learned the summoning action, you will never lose it, and it can be used with all classes or jobs. You can only summon one minion at a time.
While minions do not generate any enmity, neither will they participate in battle. If you are KO'd, your minion will simply wander off back to wherever it is it rests until you call upon it again.

Once you have used the item, a new entry will appear in the <color #FF7B1A>Minion Guide</color> under <color #FF7B1A>Character</color> in the main menu. You can either initiate the action from this menu, or set it to your <color #FF7B1A>cross hotbar</color> and initiate it from there.

To send your minion away, simply re-select the summoning icon.\n\nMinions can be summoned or dismissed at any time, and the whistle has no recast timer. Once you have learned the summoning action, you will never lose it, and it can be used with all classes or jobs. You can only summon one minion at a time.
You are now able to <color #FF7B1A>dye</color> items! To dye a piece of gear, you must first have the proper colorant. Colorant can be crafted or purchased in stores.

Once you have the proper colorant, dyeing an item is as easy as selecting the <color #FF7B1A>Dye icon</color> from the <color #FF7B1A>Actions & Traits</color> interface.\n\nThere is no limit to how many times an item can be dyed. Dye can also be removed by using an item called <color #FF7B1A>terebinth</color>.

Similarly, if you wish to paint a housing fixture or furnishing, you can do so by selecting <color #FF7B1A>Dye</color> by accessing <color #FF7B1A>Housing</color> within the <color #FF7B1A>Social</color> menu. Alternately, furnishings can also be painted when selected from the inventory.
You can now convert items into materia!\n\nMateria created from one piece of gear can be affixed to another, improving its attributes.

To convert an item into materia, you must have first created a <color #FF7B1A>spiritbond</color> with it by using the piece repeatedly in battle, crafting, or gathering. Once an item's spiritbond reaches 100%, you will be able to select <color #FF7B1A>Convert</color> from the list of available subcommands.
Once an item is converted into materia, it can never be restored.\n\nAffixing materia to an item can only be done by a Disciple of the Hand with the proper training.

You can now meld materia to items!\n\nGear can be enhanced significantly by affixing materia to the slots available on most weapons, tools, and armor. The number of slots available on a piece of gear can be confirmed by viewing its help text.

To affix materia to an item, highlight a piece of gear and select <color #FF7B1A>Meld</color> from the subcommands. Next, select the materia which you wish to affix. A catalyst of <color #FF7B1A>carbonized matter</color> is required to complete the meld. If you wish to remove materia from an item, you must visit Mutamix, as only he can do so.
By learning the general action <color #FF7B1A>Advanced Materia Melding</color>, you can now attempt to attach materia to gear which has all its materia slots filled.

While the benefits of having multiple materia attached to your gear can be great, success is not guaranteed, and the consequences for failure can be great. A botched meld will result in the loss of not only the catalyst, but also the materia.

The type of gear determines which Disciple of the Hand class can meld materia to it. Items constructed of metal plate will usually require the talents of an <color #FF7B1A>armorer</color>. Cloth outfits, the talents of a <color #FF7B1A>weaver</color>. The level of an item also plays a role in who can or cannot enhance the gear.

If you lack the ability to meld your materia to an item, one option is to find a similar piece of armor with materia already attached. The <color #FF7B1A>markets</color> are a perfect place to find specially crafted items synthesized by Disciples of the Hand from across Eorzea.

Another option is to find another PC to meld the materia for you. One way to do this is via the <color #FF7B1A>Player Search</color> feature. Once you have found a PC capable of doing the meld and terms have been agreed upon, target the player and select <color #FF7B1A>Request Meld</color> from the <color #FF7B1A>subcommands</color>.

The Disciple of the Land actions <color #FF7B1A>Truth of Forests</color> and <color #FF7B1A>Truth of Mountains</color> enable you to detect <color #FF7B1A>unspoiled</color> gathering locations and display their location on the <color #FF7B1A>minimap</color>. These special sites cannot be found with <color #FF7B1A>Lay of the Land</color> or <color #FF7B1A>Arbor Call</color>.

These elusive points are not always present, and once spent, may take hours or days to return. They have even been known to dissipate upon abandoning gathering, regardless of whether or not the point was depleted.\n\nIt is rumored, however, that there may be a pattern to when and where they appear...

Upon accessing certain high-level gathering points, you may find that items are <color #FF7B1A>out of reach</color>. To find out what these items are, you will have to spend your turns clearing away excess growth or debris.
If you are lucky, you may find a rare item. If not, you may find the slot barren. Either way, you will not know until the debris is removed.

The higher your <color #FF7B1A>gathering</color> rating, the more debris you will clear with each attempt. There are also high-level actions such as <color #FF7B1A>Toil of the Pioneer</color> and <color #FF7B1A>Toil of the Mountaineer</color> that, when used, instantly clear away all debris at a gathering point, allowing you to see where the items are located without having to use up your attempts.

Miners can use pickaxes and other digging tools to mine the mountains of Eorzea and gather materials for use in crafting. Locations that are prime for mining are known as <color #FF7B1A>mineral deposits</color>.

Mineral deposits are only discernible from other stones when using the action <color #FF7B1A>Prospect</color>. While this action is active, the location of mineral deposits is displayed on the <color #FF7B1A>minimap</color>.
Once you have arrived at a mineral deposit, select it to begin mining.

In addition to mining, miners can use secondary tools to <color #FF7B1A>quarry</color> items from patches of stone referred to as <color #FF7B1A>rocky outcrops</color>. As is the case with mineral deposits, these locations are only discernible when using the action <color #FF7B1A>Prospect</color>.
To quarry, you must first equip a <color #FF7B1A>sledgehammer</color> to your <color #FF7B1A>off hand</color>. Sledgehammers can be obtained from shops, markets, or quests.
To fish, you must first change your class to <color #FF7B1A>fisher</color> by equipping a <color #FF7B1A>rod</color> in your <color #FF7B1A>main hand</color>.

If the body of water you are near is fishable, the icon for the <color #FF7B1A>Cast</color> action will glow. Determine a bait to apply to your line by selecting the <color #FF7B1A>Bait</color> action and then checkmarking the desired item from the list that appears.

Some bait can only be used in certain locations or for landing certain types of fish. Bait and tackle can be harvested, made by Disciples of the Hand, or purchased from various merchants or fieldcraft vendors. Always make sure your inventory is stocked before heading out into the wild.

Your <color #FF7B1A>fishing log</color> contains invaluable information on everything from fishing hole locations, to detailed fish data, to personal records. The log can be found under <color #FF7B1A>Logs</color> in your <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>.

In addition to bait, there exist several types of man-made <color #FF7B1A>lures</color>. Lures are applied to your line in the same manner as bait.\n\nFish can sense the difference between live bait and lures; therefore it may take longer for you to register a bite.

On the other hand, lures can be reused multiple times, as well as employed to land prey too large for smaller bait. Being able to choose the right bait or lure for the situation is what separates the amateur from the professional.

Mooching is a technique that involves catching a smaller fish, and then leaving that fish on the line to lure in a larger fish. Mooching can only be attempted if the first fish caught is of high quality and is suitable for mooching.

There are some varieties of large fish that can only be landed via mooching. Increase your <color #FF7B1A>perception</color> rating to increase your chances of landing a massive catch, and then use that fish to lure in an even rarer find.

No water, no problem! In Eorzea, experienced fishers find casting their lines into deserts (<color #FF7B1A>dunefishing</color>) and off mountain cliffs (<color #FF7B1A>skyfishing</color>) just as rewarding as casting them into a lake or river.
Once you have learned the <color #FF7B1A>traits</color> that unlock these special techniques, you will next need to equip your tackle box with special sky- and dunefishing bait.

The higher your <color #FF7B1A>perception</color> rating, the better chance you have of landing larger fish. Fish over a certain length are deemed high-quality (<color #FF7B1A>HQ</color>) and, depending on the variety, may be usable for <color #FF7B1A>mooching</color>.

Scattered about Eorzea there are legendary <color #FF7B1A>fishing holes</color> that only a handful of fishers can recognize amongst the normal waters. Once you have learned <color #FF7B1A>Gulleye</color>, perhaps you, too, can try your luck at these prime fishing locations.
A treasure coffer has appeared! Ofttimes, leve targets will drop treasure while being pursued. If you don't claim it, someone else will, so what are you waiting for?

You have discovered a wanted target. While not necessary to complete the leve objectives, defeating the enemy will earn you a portion of the bounty placed on its head. Take care, however, for these targets are usually quite powerful.

Grand Company leves are special missions available only to Grand Company members, and can only be accepted by speaking to a company officer. Completing one of these levequests will not only earn you items and experience, but company seals as well.

<color #FF7B1A>Instanced raids</color> are party-based content which take place in closed environments such as dungeons. The term “instanced” refers to the fact that these areas are reserved for a single group of players, meaning that you will not encounter any others during your time in them.\n\nParties must rely on their own wits and strength to conquer the many challenges that await them, such as deadly traps, complex mazes, and powerful bosses.

To add to the challenge, instanced raids have numerous requirements such as time limits, level restrictions, and limitations of changing classes or jobs while within.\n\nFinally, raids can be joined either by forming a party and speaking with the NPC at the entrance, or by using the <color #FF7B1A>Duty Finder</color> to automatically pair you with other adventurers around the world with the same ambitions.

Congratulations! You have just received your first <color #FF7B1A>achievement</color>! Achievements are earned by reaching certain milestones during your adventures in Eorzea, and there are achievements for just about everything─from leveling classes and uncovering locations, to defeating enemies and earning gil.

There are also rewards granted upon attaining certain achievements. Some of these include rare weapons and armor, others <color #FF7B1A>titles</color> which can be added to your display name to showcase your greatness.\n\nAchievement rewards can be claimed from <color #FF7B1A>Jonathas</color> in Old Gridania.

The <color #FF7B1A>Recommendations</color> list displays quests or duties currently available in your area. Highlighting an item in the list will display further information regarding the duty, such as location.
Recommendations are helpful for finding quick gil and experience, or simply confirming if there are any quests or hunting log targets in the area you might have missed.

By unlocking the Duty Finder, you can now undertake multiplayer duties without having to form a party on your own.\n\nPress the <color #FF7B1A>U</color> key or select <color #FF7B1A>Duty Finder</color> under Duty from the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color> to bring up the finder interface.

By unlocking the <color #FF7B1A>Duty Finder</color>, you can now undertake multiplayer duties without having to form a party on your own.\n\nSelect <color #FF7B1A>Duty Finder</color> under Duty from the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color> to bring up the finder interface.

First, highlight a duty from the list and press the <color #FF7B1A>Join</color> button to begin the matching process. A <color #FF7B1A>padlock icon</color> indicates duty that cannot be accessed until you have achieved certain requirements such as level or quest completion.
Once you have registered, you can view the duty's particulars, including party and server status, by selecting <color #FF7B1A>Duty Finder</color> from the <color #FF7B1A>duty list</color>.
When your party has been successfully formed, a confirmation prompt will appear.\n\nRemember, it is good practice to work out a battle plan with your party before rushing headlong into an instance.

If someone has left your Duty Finder party, you can have the finder locate you a new member by using the <color #FF7B1A>Add Member</color> feature. Make certain you bring your new member up to speed on battle tactics once he or she arrives.

In the event multiple solo players attack the same target, the player who attacks first will <color #FF7B1A>always</color> receive <color #FF7B1A>100%</color> of the experience points and items dropped. The players who follow will be rewarded based on their contribution to the battle.\n\nIf you see a fellow player in need of a hand, do not hesitate to lend yours!

<color #FF7B1A>Melee-oriented</color> classes such as gladiator and marauder can chain together their <color #FF7B1A>weaponskills</color> to deal additional damage or inflict additional enfeeblements to their targets. This is known as a <color #FF7B1A>combo</color>.\n\n※Combos are not available to pugilists, as this melee class employs a unique weaponskill chaining system.

If a weaponskill can be chained with another, it will be indicated in the weaponskill's help text under <color #FF7B1A>Combo Action</color>. In the case of <color #FF7B1A>Vorpal Thrust</color> (to the left), if executed immediately after <color #FF7B1A>True Thrust</color>, the potency will be double (200) that of a normal Vorpal Thrust (100).

Some weaponskills must be delivered from a specified <color #FF7B1A>direction</color> to maximize their damage. In these cases, maximum damage must be dealt for the action to successfully initiate a combo.

When a weaponskill can be chained into a combo, its <color #FF7B1A>hotbar icon</color> will be outlined with a flashing yellow border. The border will fade if the weaponskill is not used within a certain amount of time.\n\nLearn which weaponskills chain together to maximize your battle efficiency.

<color #FF7B1A>Astral Fire</color> and <color #FF7B1A>Umbral Ice</color> are special status effects which allow thaumaturges to continuously deal devastating amounts of damage while still conserving their MP reserves.

Casting one of the <color #FF7B1A>Fire</color> spells gives a thaumaturge the effect of Astral Fire, which increases the potency and MP cost of further Fire spells. At the same time, it lowers the potency and MP cost of <color #FF7B1A>Blizzard</color> spells.

Conversely, casting one of the Blizzard spells gives a thaumaturge the effect of Umbral Ice, which increases the speed at which MP naturally recovers. At the same time, it lowers the potency and MP cost of Fire spells.

As a thaumaturge progresses in level, the number of Umbral Ice and Astral Fire effects which can be stacked at any one time increases─the larger the stack, the more powerful the effect.\n\nLearning when to switch between fire and ice is key to being successful in extended battles.

Unlike other melee classes, pugilists do not use a system of weaponskill combos. Instead, weaponskills are used to cycle three unique battle <color #FF7B1A>forms</color> to achieve what is called <color #FF7B1A> Greased Lightning</color>─a status that increases attack power and speed, allowing them to overwhelm their enemies in a mad flurry of punches and kicks.

Many pugilist weaponskills will either change your form upon execution, or require you to be in a certain form to execute. There are also weaponskills which will grant damage bonuses when executed while in a certain form. The three types of forms are as follows: <color #FF7B1A>raptor</color>, <color #FF7B1A>coeurl</color>, and <color #FF7B1A>opo-opo</color>.
By successfully changing your form from raptor to coeurl to opo-opo, precisely in that order, you will earn the status Greased Lightning, which simultaneously increases attack speed and power.
As you increase in level, you will acquire the ability to stack the Greased Lightning status, allowing for even faster, more deadly strikes.

You can now summon a pet to do your bidding! You only have access to one pet now, but there will be opportunities to acquire many more as you continue your adventures.\n\nCast the spell <color #FF7B1A>Summon</color> from your hotbar to complete the arcane pact.

Once your pet is summoned, a fixed hotbar known as the <color #FF7B1A>pet hotbar</color> will appear in addition to your regular hotbars. The pet hotbar is preset with all the pet commands currently available to you, freeing up your normal hotbars for your personal actions and spells.

The <color #FF7B1A>Guard</color> command orders your pet to guard his master, refraining from attacking until you attack or are attacked. The <color #FF7B1A>Steady</color> command orders your pet to refrain from attacking until you specifically order him to do so. The <color #FF7B1A>Away</color> command orders your pet to leave the battlefield.

The <color #FF7B1A>Sic</color> command allows your pet to attack at will, while the <color #FF7B1A>Obey</color> command allows your pet to attack at will, but wait for your order before using special weaponskills or spells.
Pet orders and actions can also be set to your other hotbars by selecting them from the <color #FF7B1A>Pets</color> interface found within <color #FF7B1A>Actions & Traits</color>.

Once your pet is summoned, a separate hotbar known as the <color #FF7B1A>pet hotbar</color> can be accessed by pressing <icon:14>. The pet hotbar is preset with all the pet commands currently available to you, freeing up your normal hotbars for your personal actions and spells.

You have been granted entry to the Wolves' Den! The floating arena is used by the Grand Companies of Eorzea as a training facility for their recruits. Inside the Pit, you will match your wits against other adventurers just like you. If you are interested in joining the fight, speak with the attendant on the Braveheart.

When a powerful enemy is readying a special attack during a quest battle, the <color #FF7B1A>area of impact</color> will begin to glow. Leaving the glowing area before the attack is initiated will ensure that you do not suffer any damage.

If an NPC has joined you in a quest battle, he or she will often provide you with hints displayed in a special text box near the top of the screen. Heed their words and you may just emerge victorious.

In addition to the reliving of past events and the understanding of unlearned languages, the Echo can provide you with extra strength when a battle turns sour. If you happen to be defeated during a quest battle, when you return for a second attempt, you will find that your attributes have been given a temporary boost.

Some quests require you to use a key item on an enemy target. There are two ways to do so.\n\nThe first is by right-clicking the enemy's <color #FF7B1A>target bar</color> and selecting <color #FF7B1A>Use Key Item</color> from the subcommands.
The second method is to first target an enemy, then click on the key item icon found in the <color #FF7B1A>duty list</color>.

Some quests require you to use a key item on an enemy target. There are two ways to do so.\n\nThe first is by pressing <icon:11> and selecting <color #FF7B1A>Use Key Item</color> from the subcommands.

The second method is to first target an enemy, then press <icon:20> to access the <color #FF7B1A>duty list</color>. Use the directional keys to select the key item icon and press <icon:9> to complete the action.

You have changed to a new <color #FF7B1A>battle class</color>!\n\nTo lessen the burden of leveling multiple Disciple of War and Magic classes, an experience point bonus known as the <color #FF7B1A>Armoury bonus</color> is added when slaying enemies and participating in FATEs.
This bonus grows larger the greater the discrepancy between your current level and the level of your highest class. Use this to your advantage when deciding when and how to raise secondary classes.

Some key items are used on areas rather than single targets. First, click on the item icon displayed in the <color #FF7B1A>duty list</color>. Upon selecting the item, a <color #FF7B1A>glowing radius</color> will appear on the ground that can be moved freely with the mouse into the desired position before executing.

Some key items are used on areas rather than single targets. First, press <icon:20> to access the <color #FF7B1A>duty list</color>. Upon selecting the item and pressing <icon:9>, a <color #FF7B1A>glowing radius</color> will appear on the ground that can be moved freely into the desired position before executing.

After using the <color #FF7B1A>Cast</color> action to cast your line into the water, you need simply sit back and wait for a bite. When a fish bites, you will not only see the line being tugged, but hear it. While a fish is on the line, use the <color #FF7B1A>Hook</color> action to attempt to reel in your catch.
Your chances of successfully reeling in a fish after hooking it are directly affected by the fish type and your <color #FF7B1A>gathering</color> rating.

<color #FF7B1A>Allagan tomestones</color> are relics of a long-lost civilization which perished several ages past. It is said that they contain the knowledge of the Allagan Empire, and as such are highly sought out by collectors around Eorzea.

<color #FF7B1A>Rowena</color> and her associates are representatives of one such collector, and have been sent to <color #FF7B1A>Revenant's Toll</color> in the heart of <color #FF7B1A>Mor Dhona</color> by her employer to seek out adventurers willing to exchange the tomestones they come across on their journeys for weapons and armor.

Situated in your inn room or estate, the <color #FF7B1A>armoire</color> can be used to store certain kinds of items with limited methods of obtainment. These include job-specific gear, seasonal event garb, and so forth.

Please note that only items with <color #FF7B1A>condition</color> at <color #FF7B1A>100%</color> or above can be stored. Furthermore, storing an item will reset its <color #FF7B1A>spiritbond</color> and condition, as well as remove customized elements such as dyes and crests.
Participating in and winning PvP battles will earn you a unique kind of experience known as <color #FF7B1A>PvP EXP</color>. By accumulating PvP EXP, you will rise in PvP rank.

In turn, rising in PvP rank will earn you <color #FF7B1A>Action Points</color> (AP), which can be used to strengthen <color #FF7B1A>PvP actions</color>. As the name suggests, these actions can only be used during PvP.

You can view PvP information for your character such as rank and performance records, as well as learn PvP actions by selecting <color #FF7B1A>PvP Profile</color> located under <color #FF7B1A>Character</color> in the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>.

You can view PvP information for your character such as rank and performance records, as well as learn PvP actions by selecting <color #FF7B1A>PvP Profile</color> located under <color #FF7B1A>Character</color> in the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>.

Participating in and winning PvP battles will earn you a unique kind of currency known as <color #FF7B1A>Wolf Marks</color>. Wolf Marks can be exchanged for gear and other useful battle items by speaking with one of the Maelstrom soldiers stationed at the Wolves' Den.
Each of the three nations has established a <color #FF7B1A>residential district</color>, wherein like-minded adventurers can establish a base for their activities.

Each residential district is divided into <color #FF7B1A>wards</color>, which in turn house 60 plots of land each. Wealthy individuals may purchase plots of land upon which to build their own estate halls, while free companies may jointly purchase plots.
Estate halls can be customized by installing fixtures and placing furnishings. Please note that specific company privileges are required for customization.
More information on housing can be had by speaking with the <color #FF7B1A>resident caretaker</color> stationed at each residential district.
By the entrance of each plot of land, you will find a <color #FF7B1A>placard</color>. Interacting with the placard will bring up information on the owner, if available.

In the event that the plot is <color #FF7B1A>for sale</color>, the current price will be displayed along with a <color #FF7B1A>devaluation</color> timer. Devaluation occurs every six hours (Earth time); the longer you wait, the cheaper the plot will become. However, the likelihood that another buyer will snap it up will also increase. More information on buying land can be had by speaking with the <color #FF7B1A>resident caretaker</color> stationed at each residential district.

This duty is designed to be undertaken by an <color #FF7B1A>alliance</color>, a squad of 24 adventurers formed of three <color #FF7B1A>full parties</color>. This battle composition is reserved for large-scale duties only.

While you are in an alliance, the class/job icons and HP bars of alliance members will appear to the right of the party list. By joining forces with other parties, you can achieve that which would otherwise be impossible.

You can receive only one reward item per week for completing duties in Alexander: Gordias. The instant you are awarded an item from the loot list, you relinquish your right to vie for all remaining items regardless of whether you selected <color #FF7B1A>Need</color> or <color #FF7B1A>Greed</color>.

Reward eligibility is reset <color #FFFF66>every <switch:Sunday/Monday/Tuesday/Wednesday/Thursday/Friday/Saturday> at <if:#s>:00 <if:a.m./p.m.> (Earth time)</color>.\n\nCompleting an alliance objective will produce three treasure coffers, one for each party in the alliance. This means that your chance to obtain a reward is no less than that of other duties.

The <color #FF7B1A>Party Finder</color> has been added to the <color #FF7B1A>Party</color> section of the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>. Through the Party Finder, you can either search for a party to join, or recruit other adventurers to form a party of your own.

To join a party, select <color #FF7B1A>Search for Party</color> and specify your <color #FF7B1A>Search Criteria</color>. Upon finding a compatible party, simply select <color #FF7B1A>Join Party</color>.

To recruit adventurers for your own party, select <color #FF7B1A>Recruit Members</color> and specify your <color #FF7B1A>Recruitment Criteria</color>. Interested individuals will answer the call, and you need only sit back and wait.

The <color #FF7B1A>Party Finder</color> has been added to the <color #FF7B1A>Party</color> section of the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>. Through the Party Finder, you can either search for a party to join, or recruit other adventurers to form a party of your own.
In the course of gathering, Disciples of the Land will occasionally come across <color #FF7B1A>hidden</color> items.

A hidden item may also be classified as <color #FF7B1A>rare</color>, meaning you can obtain only one before it disappears from the <color #FF7B1A>Gathering</color> window. Abilities that increase the number of items obtained during a single gathering attempt have no effect on rare items.

In the course of gathering, Disciples of the Land will occasionally discover items known as <color #FF7B1A>timeworn maps</color>. Fishers can only obtain the maps when using the <color #FF7B1A>Snagging</color> action.
These tomes can be examined by using the general action <color #FF7B1A>Decipher</color>.
If you wish to learn more about timeworn maps, it is recommended that you visit Wineport in eastern La Noscea.

By using the general action <color #FF7B1A>Decipher</color>, you can examine a <color #FF7B1A>timeworn map</color>. Doing so will change it into a key item known as a <color #FF7B1A>treasure map</color>, which, true to its name, will reveal to you the location of a hidden cache of riches.

Please note that you can only possess one treasure map at any given time. If you wish to decipher another timeworn map, you must either find the current hidden cache, or simply discard the map leading to it.

Using a <color #FF7B1A>treasure map</color> will bring up a window that reveals the rough whereabouts of a hidden cache. It is then up to you to cross-reference the area map and pinpoint its precise location.
Upon arriving at the specified location, use the general action <color #FF7B1A>Dig</color> to locate and extract the treasure. Barring any navigational errors, a chest laden with bounty will appear.
Be fairly warned! The chest may be rigged with a trap that lures ferocious creatures to you. You must defeat them if you are to walk away with life, limb, and loot.

The beast tribes of Eorzea are beset with myriad problems. By helping each tribe resolve its issues through <color #FF7B1A>beast tribe quests</color>, you can improve your <color #FF7B1A>reputation</color> among its members.
The quests that are available change on a daily basis, and you can accept up to twelve in a single day. However, you cannot accept a new quest while the previous day's is still in progress.

To view your reputation among the beast tribes, select <color #FF7B1A>Reputation</color> from the <color #FF7B1A>Character</color> menu. By winning the trust of the beastmen, not only will you gain an insight into their lives; you will also be initiated into their mysteries.

Completing a <color #FF7B1A>beast tribe quest</color> will improve your <color #FF7B1A>reputation</color> with that tribe. When your reputation has risen sufficiently, you will be able to raise it to the next rank by undertaking a special quest.
As your bond with the beast tribe strengthens, you will be able to purchase an ever-expanding range of items from tribe vendors.
The beastmen deal in wares found nowhere else in the world, and the only way to obtain them is to win their trust!

Certain duties require you to carry an object and deliver it to a destination. While carrying an object, a <color #FF7B1A>transporting icon</color> will appear in your status bar. The timer above this icon indicates the amount of time you have left to complete the delivery.
Receiving damage while transporting incurs a time penalty. If the timer falls to zero, you will drop the object and be unable to continue the duty.

Through sylphic magicks, you can become <color #FF7B1A>transparent</color> and infiltrate enemy territory undetected. While in this state, a  <color #FF7B1A>transparent icon</color> will appear in your status bar. The timer above this icon indicates the amount of time you have left before the enchantment wears off.
Certain points along your route extend the duration of your transparency; use them wisely while avoiding detection. Be warned that you cannot perform any actions while transparent.
When riding certain mounts, a <color #FF7B1A>pet hotbar</color> featuring special actions will appear. These actions can be of great help in certain duties, so use them well.
When riding certain mounts, a <color #FF7B1A>pet hotbar</color> featuring special actions will appear. These actions can be of great help in certain duties, so use them well.
You have befriended Jandelaine! By using the crystal bell found in your inn room, you can call upon the services of the flamboyant <color #FF7B1A>aesthetician</color>.
From hair style and color to face paint, he can create a new look for you for a mere <color #FF7B1A>2,000 gil</color>. Whenever you feel like a change, Jandelaine is your man.

When using the <color #FF7B1A>Duty Roulette</color>, you will be assigned a random duty from among those you have unlocked. In return for leaving your destination in the hands of fate, you will receive enhanced rewards.
Furthermore, should you happen to be an <color #FF7B1A>adventurer in need</color>─that is to say, your role is in short supply─you will receive an additional bonus.

<color #FF7B1A>Vote dismiss</color> is a function whereby players who are absent for extended periods or harass others can be democratically expelled from the party. To initiate a vote, first select <color #FF7B1A>Party Members</color> from the <color #FF7B1A>Party</color> section of the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>.

Next, select the party member you wish to nominate for dismissal, then <color #FF7B1A>Vote Dismiss</color> from the submenu. You will be required to select a reason for dismissal. Please be warned that unjustified usage of vote dismiss is a punishable act.
When vote dismiss is initiated, party members will be prompted for their response. If more than half vote <color #FF7B1A>Yes</color>, the player in question will be dismissed from the party.
<color #FF7B1A>Player commendation</color> is a system whereby you can commend a party member who left a positive impression upon you in the course of duty.

Upon the conclusion of a duty, the <color #FF7B1A>Player Commendation</color> button will appear in the bottom right of the screen. Selecting it will bring up an interface wherein you can commend a player. Please note that commendations cannot be given to those who were in your party at the time of duty registration.
Commendations can be accumulated over time. By receiving a certain amount, you will unlock achievements that grant special rewards. It pays to play nice!

You can apply to join a free company from its <color #FF7B1A>profile</color> page. Review the company's focus, times active, and the roles it is seeking, then <color #FF7B1A>submit</color> your application if you believe you've found a good match.

If your application is approved, you will formally join the company. Review your current application by selecting <color #FF7B1A>Free Company</color> under <color #FF7B1A>Social</color> from the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>. From here, you can also <color #FF7B1A>withdraw</color> your application should you have a change of heart.

If your application is approved, you will formally join the company. Review your current application by selecting <color #FF7B1A>Free Company</color> under <color #FF7B1A>Social</color> from the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>. From here, you can also <color #FF7B1A>withdraw</color> your application should you have a change of heart.

The <color #FF7B1A>challenge log</color> contains a list of adventuring objectives across a wide range of categories. Completing any one of these objectives will earn you rewards. Completion status is reset on a weekly basis, and it is possible to undertake the challenges repeatedly.

The <color #FF7B1A>challenge log</color> contains a list of adventuring objectives across a wide range of categories. Completing any one of these objectives will earn you rewards. Completion status is reset on a weekly basis, and it is possible to undertake the challenges repeatedly.

Each unique challenge you complete counts towards the <color #FF7B1A>Overall Completion</color> category, which yields additional rewards. As you progress in level and advance in the scenario, more challenge objectives will become available, giving you the chance to garner richer bonuses.

You have obtained a <color #FF7B1A>master recipe book</color>. To learn the advanced recipes contained within, simply use the book in your inventory. The recipes will then appear under the <color #FF7B1A>Master</color> category of your crafting log.

Glamours allow you to alter the appearance of equipment through the use of illusory magicks. To change the appearance of an item, highlight it and select <color #FF7B1A>Cast Glamour</color> from the subcommands.

Casting glamours requires catalysts known as <color #FF7B1A>glamour prisms</color>. Please note that, for the illusion to take effect, you must be able to equip the gear whose appearance is being projected.

Glamoured items cannot be sold or traded. Furthermore, the item lending its likeness will become bound to you. With these conditions in mind, by using glamours, you can always look and perform your best!

It is possible to grow a diverse variety of plants in your garden patch. To get started, you will need to obtain <color #FF7B1A>seeds</color> and <color #FF7B1A>soil</color>. Soil comes in various grades, and influences crop yield and quality.
Seeds and soil can be obtained through gathering by botanists and miners respectively. Once you have both, you may start growing a plant at an empty bed in your garden patch.
The plants in your garden require constant tending if they are to thrive and yield crops. Plants that are neglected for too long will wither and die.
Fertilizer can be used to enrich the soil and accelerate growth, and can be applied on any one plant up to once per hour (Earth time).
Your garden has crops which are ready for harvest. When you harvest a plant and obtain its produce, it will disappear from the garden patch.
In the event that different plant species were growing side by side, they may also render up new kinds of seeds. Through experimentation, you can look forward to some truly surprising yields!

<color #FF7B1A>Ventures</color> are tasks which send retainers afield on procurement expeditions. Retainers can be instructed to either bring back specified items, or explore certain terrains for whatever items may be found, be they riches or refuse.

Assigning a venture requires a payment in a unique currency of the same name─<color #FF7B1A>ventures</color>. Ventures can be acquired through a variety of methods such as exchanging company seals, fulfilling leve objectives, and completing beast tribe quests.

Even while on a venture, retainers will promptly answer your call when summoned, and likewise can be sent to tend to your wares at the markets. Be certain to put these resourceful men and women to good use!

One of two main venture types, <color #FF7B1A>exploration</color> sends your retainer to scour the terrain of your choosing for (hopefully) precious items. There is no telling what he or she will find.
Indeed, there are certain rare items which can only be obtained through ventures, so make a point of dispatching your retainer as often as your resources allow.

You can communicate with other players via the <color #FF7B1A>chat input</color> bar situated below the <color #FF7B1A>chat log</color>. Having selected the bar, enter your message, then press the Enter key.

You can communicate with other players via the <color #FF7B1A>chat input</color> bar situated below the <color #FF7B1A>chat log</color>. Having selected the bar, enter your message, then press <icon:9>.

The recipients of your message are determined by the <color #FF7B1A>chat mode</color> currently in use. The chat mode is set to <color #FF7B1A>Say</color> by default. In this mode, your message is sent to all players within a small radius around you.
The chat mode can be changed at any time via the speech bubble icon located below the chat log.

Popular chat modes include <color #FF7B1A>Tell</color>, which sends a message to a specific player, and <color #FF7B1A>Party</color>, which sends a message to all members of your current party, regardless of their location.

The world of Eorzea is home to adventurers of various cultural and linguistic backgrounds. In order to facilitate communication in this diverse environment, the game includes a feature known as the <color #FF7B1A>auto-translation dictionary</color>.

To use the dictionary, select the <color #FF7B1A>chat input</color> bar situated below the <color #FF7B1A>chat log</color>, then press the Tab key. A list of auto-translate categories for words and expressions will appear.
