To use the dictionary, select the <color #FF7B1A>chat input</color> bar situated below the <color #FF7B1A>chat log</color>, then press the <icon:14> button. A list of auto-translate categories for words and expressions will appear.
Selecting <color #FF7B1A>2: 【Greetings】</color> and then <color #FF7B1A>3: Hello!</color> will produce the text\n<icon:55>Hello!<icon:56> in the chat input bar enclosed in special parentheses.
When sent, such text will automatically be translated into the client language being used by the recipients.
The auto-translation dictionary contains a list of everyday words and expressions as well as game-specific terms. We hope that it will prove useful during your adventures with players the world over.
Should a particular item in the marketplace catch your eye, you can add it to your <color #FF7B1A>wish list</color>. This list can contain a maximum of <color #FF7B1A>ten</color> items at one time.

The total number of players who fancy a given item will be displayed in search results, providing a quick reference as to current demand.\n\n<color #FF7B1A>※Please be advised that all wish list data will be cleared when Worlds undergo maintenance.</color>

Your retainer can be assigned any one class, with the exception of those of the Disciples of the Hand. While it is possible to reassign classes, please be warned that your retainer's progress in the current class will be reset.
A retainer's class determines which ventures he or she may embark upon. Retainers gain in level by completing ventures, but their level will never exceed your own.

The <color #FF7B1A>Trials of the Braves</color> is a collection of sacred texts spanning nine books, each of which contains a series of objectives for enhancing your <color #FF7B1A>relic weapon atma</color>. They can be acquired by exchanging Allagan tomestones with <color #FF7B1A>G'jusana</color> at Revenant's Toll.

Each book will appear in the <color #FF7B1A>Key Items</color> section of your inventory. By vanquishing all the foes listed therein with your relic weapon atma equipped, your weapon will undergo evolution.

Upon fulfilling the objectives of all nine books, your weapon will be ready to complete its evolution and become a <color #FF7B1A>relic weapon animus</color>─one step closer to one of the transcendent Zodiac Weapons.\n\n※Please note that you can only possess one book at any given time.

By infusing <color #FF7B1A>sphere scrolls</color> with the materia of your choice, you can enhance a relic weapon animus as you see fit. To infuse a sphere scroll with materia, select <color #FF7B1A>Infuse</color> from its subcommands.
Each sphere scroll can be infused with up to <color #FF7B1A>five</color> types of materia, granting a bonus to the corresponding attribute. Please note that materia will be consumed upon infusion.

While grade I materia will suffice for initial infusions, progressively higher grades of materia will be required to enhance an attribute past certain points. Moreover, there are limits as to how many times a given attribute may be enhanced.

Each infusion requires the use of a catalyst known as <color #FF7B1A>alexandrite</color>. Alexandrite can be obtained in exchange for Allagan tomestones or found by traveling to locations marked on <color #FF7B1A>mysterious maps</color> obtained through select quests. The material can also be obtained by participating in <color #FF7B1A>FATEs</color> with your relic weapon animus equipped.

Once you have fully infused a sphere scroll with materia, <color #FF7B1A>Jalzahn</color> can use it to enhance the corresponding relic weapon animus.\n\nIn the future, it will be possible to undo this process and apply different enhancements, should you so desire.

The Borderland Ruins located on the outskirts of the Carteneau Flats are now accessible! Control of this ancient Allagan site is decided via large-scale player-versus-player (<color #FF7B1A>PvP</color>) battles known as <color #FF7B1A>Frontline campaigns</color>. Speak with a Grand Company <color #FF7B1A>flyer</color> at one of the airship landings for further details.

<color #FF7B1A>Repair NPCs</color> can only restore an item's <color #FF7B1A>condition</color> to 100%. Repairing the same item yourself, however, will raise its condition beyond 100%, allowing for extended use before it wears down again.

If you meet the class conditions for repairing an item, you need not even change to that class to complete the action.\n\n<color #FF7B1A>※Item condition is reset to 100% when placed in an armoire.</color>

The <color #FF7B1A>sightseeing log</color> is a comprehensive record of breathtaking landscapes and stunning vistas you have discovered across Eorzea. Vistas are only recorded upon discovering the exact location noted in Millith's <color #FF7B1A>impressions</color>.

The <color #FF7B1A>sightseeing log</color> is a comprehensive record of breathtaking landscapes and stunning vistas you have discovered across Eorzea. Vistas are often difficult to reach, some requiring sprinting or jumping, and are only recorded upon discovering the exact location noted in Millith's <color #FF7B1A>impressions</color>.

<color #FF7B1A>Time of day</color> and <color #FF7B1A>weather</color> are also important to uncovering a vista, as are the <color #FF7B1A>emotes</color> you perform once you have arrived at one. Millith's impressions will often contain hints on these hidden conditions, though you may still need all your wits to discover some of the more obscure entries.\n\nOnce an entry is completed, a rough sketch and information on the location's history will be added to your log.

<color #FF7B1A>Allied Seals</color> are a type of common currency minted by the three Grand Companies forming the Eorzean Alliance. The seals are most commonly distributed as reward for tracking down and slaying <color #FF7B1A>marks</color> designated in the realm-wide <color #FF7B1A>Hunt</color>.

<color #FF7B1A>Mark bills</color> (posted once a day, Earth time) and <color #FF7B1A>elite mark bills</color> (posted once a week, Earth time) can be accepted at <color #FF7B1A>Hunt boards</color> located across Eorzea. Completing the objectives on these bills will present you with the opportunity to earn even more Allied Seals.\n\nAllied Seals can be exchanged for various weapons and items. Speak with a <color #FF7B1A>Hunt billmaster</color> for further details.
You have acquired a <color #FF7B1A>toy chest</color> containing several <color #FF7B1A>mini-games</color>. Visit an <color #FF7B1A>inn room</color> to try your hand at these popular Eorzean pastimes.
Targeting <color #FF7B1A>artillery</color> and pressing the confirm button will bring up a temporary <color #FF7B1A>hotbar</color> containing a new set of artillery-specific actions.
Selecting an action will display a <color #FF7B1A>target circle</color> indicating where the siege engine will fire. Position the circle carefully to maximize its effectiveness.

Every good fisher knows even Nophica's bounty is not limitless, and will therefore return to the water any unwanted catches so that the Matron may take them to Her bosom once more. This is called <color #FF7B1A>releasing</color>, and the action is available to all fishers. Released fish will not be added to your inventory, preserving area populations.

Once you have released a certain type of fish, you will continue to release that fish should you catch it again in the same location. If you wish to stop releasing fish, you must first end your fishing session and cast your line anew.

You are now able to <color #FF7B1A>desynthesize</color> items, reducing them to their original materials! To desynthesize an item, you must first be a <color #FF7B1A>level 30 Disciple of the Hand</color>. Select an item and choose <color #FF7B1A>Desynthesis</color> from its subcommands to begin the dismantling process.

Each discipline has its own desynthesis <color #FF7B1A>skill level</color>. Improving that skill level improves your chances at successfully taking apart an item. A high skill level also increases the chance of the desynthesis yielding a rare form of residual spiritbond energies known as <color #FF7B1A>demimateria</color>. Beware, however, for failed desynthesis attempts may result in your skill dropping.

While desynthesis skills for each discipline are independent, there is a skill point maximum that applies to all disciplines combined. Therefore, you must ultimately decide whether you wish to slightly improve all your desynthesis skills, or specialize in one or two disciplines alone.

<color #FF7B1A>Chocobo raising</color> is now available! To begin raising your trusty companion, you must first <color #FF7B1A>stable</color> him. Chocobo stables can be purchased and placed outside free company <color #FF7B1A>estates</color>. One chocobo stable can house a whole company's mounts.

While a chocobo is stabled, select <color #FF7B1A>Train</color> to increase his EXP. After the training is complete, do not forget to give the chocobo a <color #FF7B1A>reward</color> for his hard work. Depending on the type of reward the bird is given, his progress may change dramatically.
Continuously <color #FF7B1A>feeding</color> your chocobo a snack of vibrant vegetables or fruits will cause him to grow feathers of a different color.

You must be a <color #FF7B1A>Disciple of the Hand</color> to accept or complete Ehcatl Nine beast tribe quests. Items required to complete these quests can only be synthesized after equipping a pair of <color #FF7B1A>Ehcatl wristgloves</color>.

Experience points earned by completing these quests will be allocated to your current class. The amount of experience awarded upon completion can be viewed in your <color #FF7B1A>journal</color>, and will automatically update in the event you change your class.

You will earn <color #FF7B1A>quota points</color> for each item submitted during an Ehcatl Nine delivery quest. Only by earning enough points will you meet your quota and complete the quest. The list of items currently sought by the Ixali faction can be viewed via the <color #FF7B1A>Timers</color> interface located under <color #FF7B1A>Duty</color> in the main menu.
Any of the items on the list can be submitted towards your quota. The icon to the left of the item name indicates which Disciple of the Hand class will earn experience points for delivery.

Unlike other beast tribe quests, you will not be allowed to reaccept a delivery quest in the event you abandon it, and must wait a day (Earth time) before being issued another allowance. Moreover, the list of currently sought items will be updated each day at <if:#s>:00 <if:p.m./a.m.> (Earth time), and items previously sought may no longer be accepted.

Outfitting your level 50 retainer with the proper gear will increase her chances of finding rare items while on exploration ventures. After assigning your retainer a quick exploration venture, keep an eye on your log window for a message telling you whether or not her current equipment is sufficient.

<color #FF7B1A>Transfiguration</color> is the term used to describe when a character has temporarily taken on a physical form drastically different from their normal one. The status can be removed at any time by selecting it.
The status will also be removed upon logging out or leaving the current area.

Your relic weapon novus can now be <color #FF7B1A>soulglazed</color>! Speak with Jalzahn to have him apply the coating so that you may begin <color #FF7B1A>attuning</color> soul energy to the item by wielding it in battle.

Use a <color #FF7B1A>Zodiac glass</color> while equipped with a relic weapon novus to determine the item's current level of <color #FF7B1A>soul attunement</color>. If you happen to misplace your Zodiac glass, a new one can be obtained from <color #FF7B1A>Drake</color> in Hyrstmill.
Participating in certain duties will accelerate the rate with which soul attunement is achieved. Inquire with other adventurers as to which activities yield the best results.

Once you believe soul attunement has been achieved, take your weapon back to <color #FF7B1A>Jalzahn</color> in Hyrstmill to complete the upgrading process.\n\nRemember, soul energy can only attune to weapons which have been soulglazed. If you decide to enhance additional relic weapons, do not forget to first take them to Jalzahn.

You have thinned the population of fish in this area enough to lure forth a rare species which normally remains hidden. There are several types of these timid wavekin in waters, sands, and skies across Eorzea.
These rare fish, however, will not remain in the area for long, so once you have detected one, focus all your efforts on not letting him be the “one that got away.”

You have caught an elusive fish that will only appear when one specific weather type follows another! There are several types of these fickle creatures in waters, sands, and skies across Eorzea, so keep an eye out for meteorological changes while casting your line.

In addition to their deadly weaponskills, ninjas have at their disposal special battle techniques known as <color #FF7B1A>ninjutsu</color>, which are readied by first making a series of ritual hand gestures known as <color #FF7B1A>mudra</color>.

Ninjutsu can be executed after combining one or more of the following three mudra in a pre-determined order:

<color #FFFF66>Ten (Heaven)</color>
<color #FFFF66>Chi (Earth)</color>
<color #FFFF66>Jin (Man)</color>

You will learn new mudra as you progress through the ninja storyline. Learning new mudra will open the door to more complex ninjutsu techniques.
Once you have obtained a new ninjutsu technique, you can confirm the proper mudra order required to execute it by selecting its icon in the <color #FF7B1A>Actions & Traits</color> interface.

The <color #FF7B1A>Ceremony of Eternal Bonding</color> is a special rite of passage for two individuals wishing to pledge each other a lifetime of devotion. Only those who have proved their commitment through a long and perilous quest will be granted access to the Ivory Chapel where they will be united in the divine light of the Twelve.

This quest can be accepted at the Sanctum of the Twelve from the ceremony planner <color #FF7B1A>Claribel</color> upon meeting the following requirements:

You are currently in a party with your partner
You both have equipped a <color #FF7B1A>promise wristlet</color>
You both have completed the main scenario quest, <color #FF7B1A>The Scions of the Seventh Dawn</color>

Preparations for the final ceremony─both physical and spiritual─will be made during the course of Claribel's quest. This includes the selection of ceremony attire and the creation of rings.\n\nOnce the first step has been taken, countless more await. Let them be a test of your devotion!

Now that you have completed <color #FF7B1A>The Ties that Bind</color>, you may speak with ceremony planning assistant <color #FF7B1A>Raitmeaux</color> to determine the particulars of your big day. Both you and your partner will have the opportunity to request how the ceremony will be held, however, only the decisions made by one of you will be reflected, so make sure you both select the same options.

Permission to use the <color #FF7B1A>Ivory Chapel</color>─the hallowed hall within the Sanctum of the Twelve used for Bonding Ceremonies─must be granted by Sanctum dedicant <color #FF7B1A>Etoinelle</color>. Reservations can be made at any time, with schedules for each week being posted at <if:#s>:00 <if:p.m./a.m.> every Friday (Earth time). If in the event you are forced to cancel a reservation, you must wait until the next week to make a new one.

Upon completing your chapel reservation, the dedicant will present you with a customizable invitation which you can send to guests.\n\n<color #FF7B1A>※Please note that due to server issues, there may be times unavailable for reservation.</color>

On the day of the ceremony, you must first speak with Etoinelle to gain admittance to the Sanctum. Once inside, you will be presented with an <color #FF7B1A>eternity bell</color> which is rung when you wish to proceed to the next stage of the ceremony.

You have received an invitation to a <color #FF7B1A>Ceremony of Eternal Bonding</color> to be held at the <color #FF7B1A>Sanctum of the Twelve</color>. Please take care not to discard or trade the item.
The date and time of the ceremony are detailed in the invitation's help text. Speak with dedicant <color #FF7B1A>Etoinelle</color> to gain admittance to the Sanctum.
You now possess a <color #FF7B1A>fledgling chocobo registration form</color>! This document grants you sole ownership of a newly hatched chocobo bred specially to race.

Until its maiden race, your fledgling will be trained and cared for by the chocobokeeps at <color #FF7B1A>Moogle's Gift Mounts</color> in Bentbranch Meadows. If you happen to lose your registration form, ownership is rescinded, so store the document in a safe location.

After officially registering your fledgling as a race chocobo, it will be moved from Bentbranch Meadows to the stables at the <color #FF7B1A>Manderville Gold Saucer</color>. All further training will be conducted here.\n\nRemember, adventurers may only own a single race chocobo. If you would like another, you must first retire the one you currently possess.

Your race chocobo has learned an <color #FF7B1A>ability</color>!\n\nThere are two types of race abilities. The first are active abilities which are automatically set to the race hotbar, allowing you the freedom to choose the timing of their execution. The second type includes latent traits─such as resistance against certain enfeeblements─which remain active for the duration of a race.
Some abilities are passed down from a chocobo's parents. These are called <color #FF7B1A>hereditary</color>. Others are learned. These are called <color #FF7B1A>acquired</color>.

While hereditary abilities cannot be forgotten, acquired ones can by using a bottle of <color #FF7B1A>lethe water</color>.\n\nIf you have the means to afford them, <color #FF7B1A>training manuals</color> can be purchased to teach your race chocobo the ability of your choice.

Your race chocobo has achieved rank 40!\n\nRank 40 chocobos can be retired without handing over complete ownership to the Manderville Gold Saucer. Once retired, a chocobo can be bred, resulting in a new chocobo for you to train and race. This process is called <color #FF7B1A>covering</color>.

The type of fledgling chocobo that is born as a result of covering is based solely on the pedigree and pedigree level of its parents. Pedigree level is determined by the strength of a chocobo's individual attributes such as acceleration and cunning.

While the pedigree of both parents plays a role in determining the pedigree level of a newborn fledgling, the blood of the lower-leveled parent will often have more influence on the resulting offspring.

Finally, if you do not have both a male and female chocobo retired, you can hire a breeding chocobo for the covering process. Stock with higher pedigree levels will, of course, require more MGP to use.

Before you can create a deck with your new Triple Triad cards, you must first </color>claim</color> them. Open up your inventory and <color #FF7B1A>Use</color> a card to claim it. Once you have claimed enough cards to make a deck (at least five), select <color #FF7B1A>Gold Saucer</color> under <color #FF7B1A>Character</color> in the <color #FF7B1A>main menu</color>. From there, select <color #FF7B1A>Card Decks</color> to begin building your masterpiece.

Once you've built a deck, all that's left is to find an opponent and challenge them to a match.\n\nIf you have any questions on how to play Triple Triad, be sure to ask the <color #FF7B1A>Triple Triad master</color> for a private lesson.
You have now entered the world of Triple Triad match play. If you see someone with a <color #FF7B1A>card icon</color> next to their name, it means they are currently seeking a match.

Triple Triad matches are not only limited to the confines of the Manderville Gold Saucer. You can seek a match with other PCs anywhere in Eorzea.\n\nGood luck and may the Spinner's pull be ever kind!
Welcome to the <color #FF7B1A>Manderville Gold Saucer</color>, where all your dreams can come true!

That is, all your dreams can come true if you have enough Manderville Gold Saucer points (MGP). Gil can be exchanged for MGP at the main counter in the middle of Entrance Square. The current rate is 10 gil for one MGP. Ul'dahn law prevents the Gold Saucer from exchanging MGP if the patron already possesses more than 500.

MGP cannot be converted back into gil, but the points can be used to purchase an assortment of wonderful prizes from the <color #FF7B1A>prize claim</color> attendant, also located at the main counter in Entrance Square.

Your race chocobo has gone up in <color #FF7B1A>rank</color>!\n\nThe types of races your chocobo can participate in are determined by its <color #FF7B1A>rating</color>. The higher the rating, the more prestigious the races made available to you and your steed will become.
Your chocobo's rating is determined by several factors, including its rank and pedigree.
To ensure chocobos are evenly matched, lower class races will become unavailable once a steed achieves a certain rating.
You have received a <color #FF7B1A>Soul of the Crafter</color>! Trading it for a specialized soul will allow you to become a <color #FF7B1A>specialist</color> in that particular discipline.

Specialists will be able to access unique actions that allow for more efficient and higher-quality synthesis in their specialized fields. You may select up to three different disciplines in which to specialize.\n\nAdding, removing, or changing a specialty can be done at any time, but please note that new Souls of the Crafter may be difficult to acquire.

Some NPCs will seek to barter with you for your collectables, but will require that the items are of a certain collectability. Confirm these numbers before gathering or crafting a collectable, lest you procure an item no one wants.
You have attuned with all the aether currents in the area! Summon forth a <color #FF7B1A>flying mount</color> and try <color #FF7B1A>jumping</color> to take off.

Flying consists of three basic maneuvers:

<color #FF7B1A>Advancing</color>
 Movement keys
<color #FF7B1A>Ascending</color>
 Jump key
<color #FF7B1A>Descending</color>
 Draw/sheathe weapon key

Flying consists of three basic maneuvers:

<color #FF7B1A>Advancing</color>
 Analog stick
<color #FF7B1A>Ascending</color>
 <icon:12> button
<color #FF7B1A>Descending</color>
 <icon:13>+<icon:14> button

Astrologians contribute to party battle by using cards known as <color #FF7B1A>arcana</color> to support allies. The six major arcana include:\n\nThe Balance, the Bole, the Spire, the Spear, the Arrow, and the Ewer.

The arcana are used in conjunction with four different commands:
Draw, Spread, Shuffle, and Royal Road.

Use the <color #FF7B1A>Draw</color> command to remove a random card from your deck. Use the command again to put the card into play.

The <color #FF7B1A>Spread</color> command can be used to add a card to your spread, allowing for later use. Use the command again to play the card.


The <color #FF7B1A>Shuffle</color> command is used when you wish to return a drawn card to your deck and draw another.\n\n<color #FF7B1A>Royal Road</color> can be used while a card is drawn to alter its effect in one of three ways (enhanced potency, extended duration, or expanded range) depending on the type of card.
Individual card effects are indicated in each card's help text. Choosing the right card for the right situation will be key to your success as a reader of the stars.

In addition to their firearms, machinists also employ <color #FF7B1A>turrets</color> in battle to deal extra damage to enemies or support allies. There are two types of turrets a machinist can deploy─the <color #FF7B1A>rook autoturret</color> and the <color #FF7B1A>bishop autoturret</color>.

Once a turret is deployed to the battlefield, it will idle until you use a <color #FF7B1A>weaponskill</color> on an enemy. Once the weaponskill is executed, it will begin auto-attacking the target. A turret's target can be changed by using a weaponskill on a different enemy.
The <color #FF7B1A>Promotion</color> action will disable an autoturret's attack mode and order it to generate a field that restores either nearby players' MP or TP based on the turret type.
More information on turret capabilities and effects unlocked by Promotion can be viewed in the autoturret action help text.

In addition to regular gathering points, there also exist nodes known as <color #FF7B1A>ephemeral gathering points</color>. Even though these points may appear in your gathering log, depending on the time of day, they may remain hidden in the field.

While the <color #FF7B1A>Whisperer</color> traits (<color #FF7B1A>Stone Whisperer</color> for miners, <color #FF7B1A>Tree Whisperer</color> for botanists) grant you the ability to recognize a gathering node's hidden characteristics, there are some characteristics that require the acquisition of further traits to uncover.
Even then, the characteristics will not always be visible, so when they are, do not miss out on the chance to exploit them!
You have obtained a <color #FF7B1A>favor</color>! Favors can be used to grant special temporary statuses which allow for the discovery of otherwise hidden gathering points.
Favors are area specific, and will only reveal gathering points in the area indicated in the favor's help text. Concealed gathering points will yield rare items unobtainable at normal locations.

The item you just obtained is a perfect candidate for <color #FF7B1A>aetherial reduction</color>! Reducing an item breaks it down into its base aetherial components, or simply put, renders it into another item. Once an item is reduced, it is lost forever; however, depending on the original item's <color #FF7B1A>collectability</color>, the rarity of the resulting item may increase.

You have found a <color #FF7B1A>tome of regional folklore</color>! Reading these detailed descriptions of the surrounding landscape will allow you to discover previously hidden gathering points and fishing holes. Use the item to add the locations to your <color #FF7B1A>gathering and fishing logs</color>.

Whenever you open a treasure coffer, a <color #FF7B1A>loot list</color> will appear. If someone in your party opens a coffer, you will first receive a <color #FF7B1A>notice</color> in the bottom right-hand corner of your screen. Clicking on this notice will bring up the loot list.

For each item in the chest, you will have the opportunity to select <color #FF7B1A>Need</color>, <color #FF7B1A>Greed</color>, or <color #FF7B1A>Pass</color>.

Need: You really need the item.
Greed: You want the item, but do not need it.
Pass: You do not need the item.

Once everyone in your party has made their selections, the loot will be distributed automatically.

Players may change their selection to Pass after selecting Need or Greed, but once Pass has been selected, the decision is deemed final. If all party members choose Pass, then the item will be discarded.
Gil and quest-related items will be divided evenly amongst all party members.

Whenever you open a treasure coffer, a <color #FF7B1A>loot list</color> will appear. If someone in your party opens a coffer, you will first receive a <color #FF7B1A>notice</color> in the bottom right-hand corner of your screen. Targeting and selecting this notice will bring up the loot list.

When participating in an instanced duty with a preformed or an <color #FF7B1A>undersized</color> party, the party leader can opt to employ either the <color #FF7B1A>Lootmaster</color> or <color #FF7B1A>Greed Only</color> loot rules.

The current loot rule can be changed at any time within the <color #FF7B1A>Duty Finder</color> settings, but only before a duty has commenced. The party leader should discuss any changes to the rule to avoid confusion amongst party members.

In Ishgard, levequests are not issued by the Adventurers' Guild, but by the <color #FF7B1A>Temple Knights</color>. The system, however, remains much the same, the one difference being that in addition to normal levequests which require one leve allowance to accept, there are also <color #FF7B1A>large-scale levequests</color> which require ten. These quests will require more effort, but yield richer rewards.

Treasure coffers discovered on the battlefield during battlecraft levequests will sometimes contain <color #FF7B1A>amber-encased vilekin</color>. These rare items can be exchanged with <color #FF7B1A>amber traders</color> for items unobtainable anywhere else.

You have obtained a <color #FF7B1A>collectable</color>! The higher an item's <color #FF7B1A>collectability</color>, the more attractive it is to certain NPCs who are seeking to purchase or trade for them.
Collectables cannot be stacked or sold to regular merchants, nor can they be consumed or used as material for synthesis.

Using the <color #FF7B1A>Collectable Synthesis</color> command, will grant you with the <color #FF7B1A>Collectable Synthesis</color> status. While under the effect of this status, you will have the option to “finish” an item as a collectable after the final step of successful synthesis.

Increasing an item's quality through synthesis will also increase its <color #FF7B1A>collectability</color>. If, by the final step, the collectability achieved is not at a level deemed acceptable by the NPC seeking the item, it is best to complete the synthesis normally so that the item might be sold or used.
You have learned<color #FF7B1A> Collect</color>─a special Disciple of the Land action that is used to gather an item as a <color #FF7B1A>collectable</color>.

While fishing under the effect of the <color #FF7B1A>Collector's Glove</color> status, fish landed will be gathered as collectables, their size directly affecting <color #FF7B1A>collectability</color>.
While under the effect of the <color #FF7B1A>Collector's Glove</color> status, you will be given the option to gather items as <color #FF7B1A>collectables</color>.

Items are now suitable for gathering as <color #FF7B1A>collectables</color>. Before gathering the item, use the <color #FF7B1A>Appraisal</color> actions to increase its <color #FF7B1A>rarity</color>, and in turn, its <color #FF7B1A>collectability</color>.
While appraisal increases rarity, it also increases an item's <color #FF7B1A>wear</color>. If wear increases beyond an item's limit, gathering rate will drop significantly.
